client_profile: A couple looking to buy an apartment in Brussels. Budget is 725000–1325000 EUR. Priorities include cafes & brunch, restaurants, a premium feel, and a residential environment.
red_flags: Potentially long commute from some districts
contradictions: Premium feel may conflict with budget limits
Desire for quiet areas may limit access to restaurants

top_districts.name: Ixelles

microhoods.name: Boondael
microhoods.why: Offers a green environment and lively scene with parks.
microhoods.watch_out: Popular streets can experience significant noise and tight parking.

microhoods.name: Universite
microhoods.why: Known for lively atmosphere, good transit, and vibrant cafes.
microhoods.watch_out: Can be expensive, especially for premium apartments.

why: Vibrant area with access to parks like Flagey.
Diverse dining options attract both locals and tourists.
watch_out: Expect some street noise on weekends due to nightlife.

top_districts.name: Saint-Gilles

microhoods.name: Haut Saint - Gilles
microhoods.why: Greener and quieter area with good access to amenities.
microhoods.watch_out: Some streets are lively and noisy late at night.

microhoods.name: Chatelain
microhoods.why: Offers a lively vibe with lots of cafes and restaurants.
microhoods.watch_out: Traffic noise can be an issue on busy streets.

why: Charming streets lined with cafes close to Parvis.
Excellent blend of residential and vibrant cultural life.
watch_out: Choose quieter side streets to avoid night noise.

top_districts.name: Etterbeek

microhoods.name: Chasse
microhoods.why: Lively neighborhood with good transit connections.
microhoods.watch_out: Higher rents closer to EU quarter and busy roads.

microhoods.name: Saint - Pierre
microhoods.why: Offers access to green spaces and community vibe.

why: Access to parks and cultural venues, appealing for families.
